Award.AwardTitle: Achievement Scholarship Program: Advancing Engineering, Physics, and Math in the Technological Workforce

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
A goal of the Achievement Scholarship Program (ASP) program is to increase the number of well-educated and skilled employees in technical areas of national need. An emphasis on students from the Four Corners area, especially Native Americans, is important to the continued growth and development of this region. To achieve the goal of increasing the number of well qualified US citizens in technical areas the following objectives are central to ASP.
Objective 1: Increase the number of students graduating in engineering, physics, and math.
Objective 2: Provide 15 scholarships per year to financially needy, academically talented students who meet the academic criteria and show a strong potential to be a successful graduate.
Objective 3: Provide academic mentoring, cohort activities, and support services that enable ASP Scholars to successfully complete their undergraduate degree.
Objective 4: Improve workforce integration by strengthening partnerships between the College and industry partners throughout the Four Corners Region.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of the Achievement Scholarship Program (ASP) was to increase the number of students entering the workforce in the STEM disciplines of engineering, physics and math. To do this ASP provided financial and academic support to help students complete their education. The program also assisted in the transition from student to a productive member of the modern technological workforce. The objectives of the program were,

Objective 1: Increase the number of students graduating in engineering, physics, and math.

Objective 2: Provide cholarships to financially needy, academically talented students who meet the academic criteria and show a strong potential to be a successful graduate.

Objective 3: Provide academic entoring, cohort activities, and support services that enable ASP Scholars to uccessfully complete their undergraduate degree.

Objective 4: Improve workforce ntegration by strengthening partnerships between the College and industry artners throughout the Four Corners Region.

The accomplishments associated with ach objective are listed.

Objective 1. Increase STEM raduates: The college has been implementing a comprehensive program to ncrease graduates and the NSF-SSTEM award has been a key contributor. The umber of engineering, physics and math graduates has steadily increased from 9 n 2009 to 34 in 2013 (24 in 2014). This increase of about 300% percent shows remarkable growth.

Objective 2. Provide scholarships: 84 S-STEM scholarships were awarded to 42 individuals. 19% of the scholarships were awarded to underrepresented minority students, including Native Americans from local tribes. Of the 42 students who received scholarships 25 students graduated with STEM degrees, 2 students left the problem due to poor academic performance, 2 left because they were no longer financially eligible (but are still in a STEM program) and 2 transferred to other institutions. The remainder of the  students are underclassmen and are making successful progress towards their STEM degrees. Students in the S-STEM program report that the scholarships were instrumental in allowing them to complete their degrees and successfully move into the STEM workforce.

Objective 3. Provide mentoring and academic support: Every student worked with a faculty mentor to monitor their academic progress. At regular student-mentor meetings student progress was assessed and if needed the student was provided with a tutor or other supplemental assistance determined on a case by case basis.

Objective 4. Workforce integration. Twice a year students participated in a local or regional field trip. The goal was to give students exposure to employment options and give potential employers exposure to our students (and program). Field trip sites included Los Alomos National Laboratories, Advanced Mobile Propulsion Testing Inc., US Bureau of Reclamation Animas Water Project and many others.
